byline.contributor: Nate Schweber reported from Goshen, and Lisa W. Foderaro from New York.
byline.original: By NATE SCHWEBER and LISA W. FODERARO

abstract: New York State Police investigator testifies at pretrial hearing for Angelika Graswald, who is charged with murdering her fiance Vincent Viafore on kayak trip in 2015; says that while walking with Graswald on Bannerman Island she admitted having removed plug from Viafore's kayak and taken his paddle after he capsized.
lead_paragraph: A State Police investigator also said Angelika Graswald, whom he questioned after Vincent Viafore disappeared in the cold Hudson River waters, described feeling “trapped.”

headline.main: Woman Charged in Kayak Death Admitted Keeping Paddle From Fiancé, Officer Testifies
headline.print_headline: Woman Admitted Taking Fiancé’s Paddle in Kayak Death, Officer Says

snippet: A State Police investigator also said Angelika Graswald, whom he questioned after Vincent Viafore disappeared in the cold Hudson River waters, described feeling “trapped.”
